page.title: 06NATURE RESERVE -WENT HILLS.
page.content: Part of the valley of the River Went has been designated a{Site of {Special Scientific Interest. {(S.S.S.I.)}This is known as the {Brockadale Nature Reserve}and is managed by the Yorkshire Wildlife Trust. It is made up of pasture, woodland and limestone crags. There is also a scree slope. Many rare plants may be found there, including several kinds of orchids, and cowslips. There is access for the public provided that they keep to the paths and observe the country code. This part of the valley may have got its name from the old name for badgers, "Brock" so "Brockadale" may mean "Badgers' Valley." Most of the land is owned by the Forestry Commission and much of it has been planted with sycamores.The Y.W.T. hopes to replant with suitable trees.
